cards.name: Run Wild
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and "{G}: Regenerate this creature."
cards.flavor: Wirewood's beasts didn't seem to mind when the elves moved in. In fact, they hardly noticed them underfoot.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and "{G}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.name: Serpentine Basilisk
cards.text:
Whenever Serpentine Basilisk deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Serpentine Basilisk deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Silklash Spider
cards.text:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The only thing that flies over the Krosan Forest is the wind.
cards.originalText:
Silklash Spider may block as though it had flying.
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Silvos, Rogue Elemental
cards.text:
Trample
{G}: Regenerate Silvos, Rogue Elemental.
cards.flavor: He was born of the Mirari, thrust out of his homeland before he was even aware. Left without purpose or meaning, he found both in the pits.
cards.originalText:
Trample
{G}: Regenerate Silvos, Rogue Elemental.

cards.name: Snarling Undorak
cards.text:
{2}{G}: Target Beast creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Most creatures in the Krosan Forest feared the Mirari's power. A few fed upon it.
cards.originalText:
{2}{G}: Target Beast gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Spitting Gourna
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morph {4}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Spitting Gourna may block as though it had flying.
Morph {4}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Stag Beetle
cards.text: Stag Beetle enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of other creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Its voice crackles with the hum of a thousand wings beating at once.

rulings.text: The value of X is calculated once, as Stag Beetle is entering the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Stag Beetle comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of other creatures in play.

cards.name: Steely Resolve
cards.text:
As Steely Resolve enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: No one in Wirewood understands what is happening. They just know it's unnatural—and coming from Krosa.
cards.originalText:
As Steely Resolve comes into play, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type can't be the targets of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Symbiotic Beast
cards.text: When Symbiotic Beast dies, create four 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
cards.flavor: The insects found a meal in the carrion of the beast's prey. The beast found a spiffy new hairstyle.
cards.originalText: When Symbiotic Beast is put into a graveyard from play, put four 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Symbiotic Elf
cards.text: When Symbiotic Elf dies, create two 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
cards.flavor: The elves arriving in Wirewood had no homes, let alone weapons, but they knew that the forest would always provide.
cards.originalText: When Symbiotic Elf is put into a graveyard from play, put two 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Symbiotic Wurm
cards.text: When Symbiotic Wurm dies, create seven 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
cards.flavor: The insects keep the wurm's hide free from parasites. In return, the wurm doesn't eat the insects.
cards.originalText: When Symbiotic Wurm is put into a graveyard from play, put seven 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Taunting Elf
cards.text: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.
cards.flavor: The safety of the village depends on the beast thinking with its stomach.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.

cards.name: Tempting Wurm
cards.text: When Tempting Wurm enters the battlefield, each opponent may put any number of artifact, creature, enchantment, and/or land cards from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: When Tempting Wurm comes into play, each opponent may put any number of artifact, creature, enchantment, and/or land cards from his or her hand into play.

cards.name: Towering Baloth
cards.text: Morph {6}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: The Mirari twisted all that lived in the Krosan Forest into gross mockeries of their former selves.
cards.originalText: Morph {6}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Treespring Lorian
cards.text: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: No matter your strength, the Krosan Forest is stronger. No matter your speed, the Wirewood Forest is faster.
cards.originalText: Morph {5}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Tribal Unity
cards.text: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.
cards.originalText: Creatures of the type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.

cards.name: Venomspout Brackus
cards.text:
{1}{G}, {T}: Venomspout Brackus deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature with flying.
Morph {3}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
{1}{G}, {T}: Venomspout Brackus deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature with flying.
Morph {3}{G}{G} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Vitality Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token.
• Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Regenerate target Beast.
cards.originalText: Choose one Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token into play; or target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn; or regenerate target Beast.

cards.name: Voice of the Woods
cards.text: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Create a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample.
cards.flavor: The ritual of making draws upon the elves' memories and pasts. And elves have long memories and ancient pasts.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText: Tap five untapped Elves you control: Put a 7/7 green Elemental creature token with trample into play.

cards.name: Wall of Mulch
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}, Sacrifice a Wall: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Mulch is the fabric of life in the forest. Plants live in it, they die in it, and then they become part of it, feeding countless generations to come.

rulings.text: It can be sacrificed for its own ability.

cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{G}, Sacrifice a Wall: Draw a card.

cards.name: Weird Harvest
cards.text: Each player may search their library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, and put them into their hand. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.
cards.flavor: Krosa's distorted groves bear strange fruit.
cards.originalText: Each player may search his or her library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, and put them into his or her hand. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.name: Wellwisher
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Close your ears to the voice of greed, and you can turn a gift for one into a gift for many."
cards.originalText: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf in play.

cards.name: Wirewood Elf
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: "The land belongs to nature as far as our eyes can see. The higher we climb, the more we can see."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Wirewood Herald
cards.text: When Wirewood Herald dies, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The goblins laughed as the elf ran away, until more came back.
cards.originalText: When Wirewood Herald is put into a graveyard from play, you may search your library for an Elf card. If you do, reveal that card and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Wirewood Pride
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Though you may leave this haven we have found, may our strength never leave you."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves in play.

cards.name: Wirewood Savage
cards.text: Whenever a Beast enters the battlefield, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"She is truly Wirewood's child now."
—Elvish refugee
cards.originalText: Whenever a Beast comes into play, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Words of Wilding
cards.text: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, create a 2/2 green Bear creature token instead.
cards.flavor:
"Instinct is undaunted by terror, unchained by logic. It is the path from which all other paths diverge."
—Volume V, The Book of Life

rulings.text: If multiple Words have been used prior to drawing a card, then you can choose which one to apply (and use up) each time you draw a card.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, put a 2/2 green Bear creature token into play instead.

cards.name: Cryptic Gateway
cards.text: Tap two untapped creatures you control: You may put a creature card from your hand that shares a creature type with each creature tapped this way onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Its lock changes to fit each key.

rulings.text: For this to be useful, either both creatures have to have a common creature type that the one in your hand also has, or the card in your hand needs to have at least two creature types so each tapped creature can match a different one.

cards.originalText: Tap two untapped creatures you control: You may put a creature card from your hand into play that shares a creature type with each creature tapped this way.

cards.text:

{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature of the chosen type: Doom Cannon deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
As Doom Cannon comes into play, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature of the chosen type: Doom Cannon deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Dream Chisel
cards.text: Face-down creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Itself a product of Ixidor's tortured psyche, the chisel brings his darkest dreams to life.
cards.originalText: Face-down creature spells you play cost {1} less to play.

cards.text: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: The pattern of life can be studied like a book, if you know how to read it.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.name: Deceiver of Form
cards.text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, reveal the top card of your library. If a creature card is revealed this way, you may have creatures you control other than Deceiver of Form become copies of that card until end of turn. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: You may put the card on the bottom of your library in any of the possible scenarios that could occur with this card. It doesn't matter whether the card is a creature card or not. If it is a creature card, it doesn't matter whether you chose to have the copy effect apply.

If applicable, creatures you control copy the printed values of the revealed creature card. They will retain any counters they had on them. Any Auras and/or Equipment that were attached with them will remain so.
Any noncopy effects that affected a creature you control, including ones that modified its power and/or toughness, will continue to apply.

If a creature you control becomes a copy of the revealed creature card, it's neither entering nor leaving the battlefield. Any enters-the-battlefield or leaves-the-battlefield abilities won't trigger.

cards.originalText:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, reveal the top card of your library. If a creature card is revealed this way, you may have creatures you control other than Deceiver of Form become copies of that card until end of turn. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Eldrazi Mimic
cards.text: Whenever another colorless creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may change Eldrazi Mimic's base power and toughness to that creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is consistently inconsistent.

rulings.text: Use the new creature's power and toughness at the time the ability resolves to determine the base power and toughness of Eldrazi Mimic. If that creature is no longer on the battlefield at that time, use its power and toughness when it left the battlefield. (Keep in mind that those values may be negative, for example if a spell like Spatial Contortion giving it +3/-3 is what caused it to leave the battlefield.)

Eldrazi Mimic's ability will overwrite any other effect setting its base power and toughness. Such effects that begin to apply after that ability resolves will similarly overwrite the ability. Effects that modify Eldrazi Mimic's power and/or toughness but don't set its base power and/or toughness to specific values will apply no matter when they started to apply. The same is true for any +1/+1 counters it may have.

foreignNames.name: エルドラージのミミック

cards.originalText: Whenever another colorless creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may change Eldrazi Mimic's base power and toughness to that creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Endbringer
cards.text:
Untap Endbringer during each other player's untap step.
{T}: Endbringer deals 1 damage to any target.
{C}, {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
{C}{C}, {T}: Draw a card.

rulings.text: Endbringer untaps at the same time as the active player's permanents. You can't choose to not untap it at that time.
If an effect states that Endbringer doesn't untap during your untap step, that effect won't apply during another player's untap step.
Activating the second activated ability after a creature has legally been declared as an attacker or blocker won't change or undo that attack or block.

cards.originalText:
Untap Endbringer during each other player's untap step.
{T}: Endbringer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{C}, {T}: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
{C}{C}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Kozilek, the Great Distortion
cards.text:
When you cast this spell, if you have fewer than seven cards in hand, draw cards equal to the difference.
Menace
Discard a card with converted mana cost X: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor: A void as cryptic as reality itself.

rulings.text: Kozilek's triggered ability checks to see if you have fewer than seven cards in hand when you cast it. Kozilek is on the stack at this time and not in your hand. If you don't, the ability won't trigger at all. If the ability does trigger, it will check again as it tries to resolve. If you have seven or more cards in hand at that time, the ability won't do anything.

To activate the last ability, there must be a legal target: a spell on the stack. That target will determine the value of X and the converted mana cost of the card you discard. You can't activate the ability unless you can match the converted mana cost of a spell on the stack to that of a card in your hand.

The converted mana cost of a spell doesn't change, even if it's been cast using an alternative cost (such as an awaken cost). For example, the converted mana cost of a Sheer Drop (a spell with mana cost {2}{W}) that's been cast for its awaken cost of {5}{W} is 3.
If there's an {X} in the mana cost of the card you discard, that X is 0. Any {X} in the mana cost of the target spell will have whatever value was determined for it as the spell was cast.

foreignNames.name: 大いなる歪み、コジレック

cards.originalText:
When you cast Kozilek, the Great Distortion, if you have fewer than seven cards in hand, draw cards equal to the difference.
Menace
Discard a card with converted mana cost X: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.

cards.name: Kozilek's Pathfinder
cards.text: {C}: Target creature can't block Kozilek's Pathfinder this turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)
cards.flavor:
"We didn't know where it came from or where it was going. All we knew was that we did not matter."
—Akiri, kor line-slinger

rulings.text: Activating the ability once Kozilek's Pathfinder has been legally blocked won't change or undo that block.

cards.originalText: {C}: Target creature can't block Kozilek's Pathfinder this turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

cards.name: Matter Reshaper
cards.text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
When Matter Reshaper dies, reveal the top card of your library. You may put that card onto the battlefield if it's a permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less. Otherwise, put that card into your hand.

rulings.text: If you put an Aura card onto the battlefield this way, you choose what it enchants as it enters the battlefield. You must be able to choose a legal player or permanent or you can't put the Aura onto the battlefield.
If you don't put the card onto the battlefield for any reason, you put the card into your hand.

cards.originalText:
({C} represents colorless mana.)

cards.text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
Trample, haste
Whenever Reality Smasher becomes the target of a spell an opponent controls, counter that spell unless its controller discards a card.
cards.flavor: As easy to stop as it is to comprehend.

rulings.text: The last ability will trigger due to any spell controlled by an opponent (including an Aura spell) that targets Reality Smasher.

When Thought-Knot Seer leaves the battlefield, target opponent draws a card.

cards.text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
Trample
Walker of the Wastes gets +1/+1 for each land you control named Wastes.
cards.flavor: In the absence of life, something yet grows.

rulings.text: The last ability applies only if Walker of the Wastes is on the battlefield.

({C} represents colorless mana.)
Trample
Walker of the Wastes gets +1/+1 for each land you control named Wastes.

cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {C}. ({C} represents colorless mana.)
cards.flavor: The wastelands disorient even the most experienced scouts, making them easy prey for Kozilek's drones.

Vigilance
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

cards.name: Warping Wail
cards.text:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
Choose one —
• Exile target creature with power or toughness 1 or less.
• Counter target sorcery spell.
• Create a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C}."
cards.originalText:
({C} represents colorless mana.)
Choose one —
• Exile target creature with power or toughness 1 or less.
• Counter target sorcery spell.
• Put a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

cards.name: Eldrazi Displacer
cards.text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{2}{C}: Exile another target creature, then return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

rulings.text: If a creature token is exiled this way, it will cease to exist and will not return to the battlefield.

After the creature returns to the battlefield, it will be a new object with no connection to the creature that was exiled. It won't be in combat or have any additional abilities it may have had when it was exiled. Any +1/+1 counters on it or Auras attached to it are removed, and any Equipment will no longer be attached.

cards.originalText:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{2}{C}: Exile another target creature, then return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

cards.name: Affa Protector
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: "Through all the terrors we face, I hold on to the memory of the world before the Eldrazi came. I'd like to see that world again."
cards.originalText: Vigilance

cards.name: Allied Reinforcements
cards.text: Create two 2/2 white Knight Ally creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "Our formation was scattered after Sea Gate fell. If you're fighting the Eldrazi, consider us your newest recruits."
cards.originalText: Put two 2/2 white Knight Ally creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Call the Gatewatch
cards.text: Search your library for a planeswalker card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"I've heard it said that a Planeswalker is someone who can always run from danger. But Gideon's right: we're also the ones who can choose to stay."
—Jace Beleren
cards.originalText: Search your library for a planeswalker card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Dazzling Reflection
cards.text: You gain life equal to target creature's power. The next time that creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor:
"The light of a felidar's horns can give even an Eldrazi pause."
—Zarra, lullmage

rulings.text: You gain the life as soon as Dazzling Reflection resolves, not as the damage is prevented.

If two Dazzling Reflections targeting the same creature have resolved in the same turn, only one prevention effect will apply the next time it would deal damage. The other effect will apply if the creature would deal damage a second time later that turn.

cards.originalText: You gain life equal to target creature's power. The next time that creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Expedition Raptor
cards.text:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

rulings.text: You can't put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don't control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.name: General Tazri
cards.text:
When General Tazri enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Ally creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Ally creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of colors among those creatures.

rulings.text: The last ability checks only Ally creatures you control as the ability resolves. The value of X will be between 0 and 5. Colorless is not a color.
Once the last ability resolves, the bonus given doesn't change, even if the number of colors among your Allies does.

cards.originalText:
When General Tazri enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Ally creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Ally creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of colors among those creatures.

cards.name: Immolating Glare
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"The sun can warm your skin or blister it, nurture your crops or wither them, light your path or blind you. She is a fickle friend, but a far worse enemy."
—Nazra of the Stone Havens
cards.originalText: Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.name: Iona's Blessing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has vigilance, and can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor:
"Walk now in my light. When the rest of the world closes its eyes, you will still see."
—Iona

rulings.text: The ability to block an additional creature is cumulative. If a creature is enchanted with two Iona's Blessings, it can block three creatures each combat. (The +2/+2 is also cumulative, but you knew that.)

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has vigilance, and can block an additional creature.

cards.name: Isolation Zone
cards.text: When Isolation Zone enters the battlefield, exile target creature or enchantment an opponent controls until Isolation Zone leaves the battlefield. (That permanent returns under its owner's control.)
cards.flavor: When properly aligned, hedrons become powerful tools of binding.

rulings.text: If Isolation Zone leaves the battlefield before its triggered ability resolves, the target creature or enchantment won't be exiled.

Auras attached to the exiled creature or enchantment will be put into their owners' graveyards. Any Equipment will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.
If a token is exiled, it ceases to exist. It won't be returned to the battlefield.
The exiled card returns to the battlefield immediately after Isolation Zone leaves the battlefield. Nothing happens between the two events, including state-based actions.

In a multiplayer game, if Isolation Zone's owner leaves the game, the exiled card will return to the battlefield. Because the one-shot effect that returns the card isn't an ability that goes on the stack, it won't cease to exist along with the leaving player's spells and abilities on the stack.

cards.originalText: When Isolation Zone enters the battlefield, exile target creature or enchantment an opponent controls until Isolation Zone leaves the battlefield. (That permanent returns under its owner's control.)

cards.name: Kor Scythemaster
cards.text: Kor Scythemaster has first strike as long as it's attacking.
cards.flavor: The kor of Zendikar are known for quiet determination in the face of overwhelming odds.
cards.originalText: Kor Scythemaster has first strike as long as it's attacking.

cards.name: Kor Sky Climber
cards.text: {1}{W}: Kor Sky Climber gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "With rope, I can fly as far as the rope can reach. But with light, the sky is the limit."
cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Kor Sky Climber gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Linvala, the Preserver
cards.text:
Flying
When Linvala, the Preserver enters the battlefield, if an opponent has more life than you, you gain 5 life.
When Linvala enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more creatures than you, create a 3/3 white Angel creature token with flying.

rulings.text: For each triggered ability, the game checks to see if the condition is true at the moment the ability would trigger. If the condition isn't true, the ability won't trigger. If the ability does trigger, the game will check again to see if the condition is true as the ability tries to resolve. If it's not true at that time, the ability won't do anything.
In a multiplayer game, it's possible for the condition to be true at both times but with respect to two different opponents.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Linvala, the Preserver enters the battlefield, if an opponent has more life than you, you gain 5 life.
When Linvala enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more creatures than you, put a 3/3 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Make a Stand
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)
cards.flavor: For a moment they stood tall, all fear forgotten.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

cards.name: Makindi Aeronaut
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "The Eldrazi have surprised us before. It's my job to make sure that never happens again."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We may have lost faith in our gods, but we are far from losing faith in ourselves."
—Munda, ambush leader

rulings.text: Giving a creature flying after it's already been blocked won't change or undo that block. If you want to affect what can block the creature, you must cast Mighty Leap during the declare attackers step at the latest.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
